    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open(String uId)
          throws Exception
        Description copied from class: Sink.Writer
        Performs bundle initialization. For example, creates a temporary file for writing or initializes any state that will be used across calls to Sink.Writer.write(T).

        The unique id that is given to open should be used to ensure that the writer's output does not interfere with the output of other Writers, as a bundle may be executed many times for fault tolerance. See Sink for more information about bundle ids.

        Specified by:
        open in class Sink.Writer<KV<K,V>,String>
        Throws:
        Exception

      • write

        public void write(KV<K,V> value)
           throws Exception
        Description copied from class: Sink.Writer
        Called for each value in the bundle.
        Specified by:
        write in class Sink.Writer<KV<K,V>,String>
        Throws:
        Exception

      • close

        public String close()
             throws Exception
        Description copied from class: Sink.Writer
        Finishes writing the bundle. Closes any resources used for writing the bundle.

        Returns a writer result that will be used in the Sink.WriteOperation's finalization. The result should contain some way to identify the output of this bundle (using the bundle id). Sink.WriteOperation.finalize(java.lang.Iterable<WriteT>, org.apache.beam.sdk.options.PipelineOptions) will use the writer result to identify successful writes. See Sink for more information about bundle ids.

        Specified by:
        close in class Sink.Writer<KV<K,V>,String>
        Returns:
        the writer result
        Throws:
        Exception

        Description copied from class: Sink.Writer
        Returns the write operation this writer belongs to.
